Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a brown ribbed pottery vessel, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous material, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of nine lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn in parts, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.200-201)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36483) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36483)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 347 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
